meanings.definition: To surpass in blazing or shining brightly.
meanings.sent1: The sun outblazed all the stars in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks outblazed the city lights on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent3: The firefly outblazed its tiny companions in the dark garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile outblazed the neon sign on the busy street.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse outblazed the stormy night, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outdo in brightness or brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The diamond outblazed all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent2: The full moon outblazed the streetlights, illuminating the path.
meanings.sent3: The flashlight outblazed the dim candle during the power outage.
meanings.sent4: Her talent outblazed the competition, earning her the first prize.
meanings.sent5: The supernova outblazed all the stars in the galaxy, a celestial spectacle.
